text: Mark Strand (April 11, 1934 â€“ November 29, 2014) was a Canadian-American poet, essayist, and translator. He was appointed Poet Laureate Consultant in Poetry to the Library of Congress in 1990. He was a professor of English and Comparative Literature at Columbia University. Strand was born in Summerside, Prince Edward Island. Strand died on November 29, 2014, in Brooklyn, New York City from liposarcoma, aged 80. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1934 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Educators from New York City Category:American poets Category:Canadian poets Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from liposarcoma Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Summerside, Prince Edward Island Category:Writers from New York City Category:Canadian translators Category:American translators Category:Canadian essayists Category:American essayists
title: Mark Strand
